pros: Awesome place to work. I definitely RECOMMEND
cons: Salary..definitely do it more than for the pay...but so worth it

review_title: You definitely don't do it to get treated like a human
job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Elmira, NY
pros: Rewarding work. You actually help people. Great people who truly care as coworkers.
cons: They're horrifically understaffed, and at some locations, you can't actually expect to work the hours you're assigned. You're pulling a lot of overtime, guiled when you can't do it, and treated like you aren't a human who needs to rest, sleep, or see your family. For the work you actually do, it's not worth what they pay you. You're given a lot of guilt if you want to look for better opportunities.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Elmira, NY
cons: Management isn’t to good in certain houses.

pros: Great non-profit, well involved in community and services many programs
cons: Little communication and accountability or training from upper management

job_title: Senior Manager of Residential in Elmira, NY
pros: The only good part about this job, is some of the persons supported
cons: Management does not care about their employees.

review_title: Toxic work environment, no regard for staff safety
pros: Good pay and benefits, sometimes the work is rewarding
cons: This is about the NY START Resource Center. It is an extremely toxic work environment, from top to bottom. No regard for staff safety and they are in such a hurry to get people on the floor they won’t give them the proper training for safety. When you do get hurt, they gaslight and manipulate you. All they care about is making money. Theres no therapy happening, it’s just a babysitting service where you frequently get beat up at. They also threaten you with mandating you to work if you don’t pick up shifts to be there every waking hour. It’s hard to make friends as people are constantly leaving

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Elmira, NY
pros: You get insurance and paid time off after a while, the people you work with are pretty great. Room to grow and receive promotions.
cons: The company doesn't seem to care too much for its employees given the large turn over rate.
Limited dayshift opportunities, so most openings are 2nd and 3rd shift.
